sentence.text: In his mind the shiny Grand Am lunged over him again .
By digging his heels into the rocks he was able to lunge a good six feet nearer the home bank .
He shifted the helm so that the storm jib lifted the bows , the catamaran lunging forward on to the wave top , surfing the squall front .
Lunging forward with a net , he caught not just a leaf but a tiny fish as well .
Duvall lunged forward and fired at the shadow .
Corbett thought it was mere drunken bravado when one of them lunged across the table and uproar ensued as food , cups and flagons of wine and ale were sent sprawling .
He lunged across the table ( so much for forced calmness ) , his hands reaching round the back of her neck to pull her towards him .
Schnitke 's language seems to lunge from outburst to tranquil apology for his own excesses -- simple , melodic threads he untangles from demonic cackle and sheer noise .
Then his eyes , red-rimmed from weeping , widened dementedly and he lunged from his place swinging the long blade of his coupe-coupe high above his head .
His confident , curving serve whistled over the net into the far corner of the court , leaving Murray to lunge futilely in its direction .
He backed away , and still they struck and lunged in his direction ; he backed away even more until he could barely see them in the gloom .

Cardiff threw himself backwards against the staircase wall , as the thing from the stairwell lunged backwards into the darkness , taking the flapping and gutted body of Peters with it , still fastened to its arm .
But while AT&T may be lunging into the Nineties , the corporate giant has not altogether abandoned the fashions of the previous decade .
It surges up the beach , still supported by the water of the dwindling wave , and with one powerful beat of its great tail , it lunges into a group of unsuspecting seal pups .
Screaming in fury , Rohmer lunged to the spot where he had vanished , stamping his feet as if dancing on Gilbert 's grave .
Joseph lunged toward it , but the sight of him terrorized the gibbon further , and it set off frantically towards the only visible refuge .
She screamed and was saved when her brother , hearing the noise , lunged towards her bedroom .
Then he ran back along the bare wooden branch that hung across his cage and turning suddenly , raised his wings in the air and lunged forward towards Creggan again .
As the sound system blared out Gary Glitter 's ` Do You Wan na be in My Gang " , he would lunge towards the crowd as he entered the ring at Finsbury Park 's Rainbow .
Adam lunged towards her , but lost his footing and crashed down again .
The animal seemed to understand Sir John 's words for it lunged towards him with a strangled growl ; its top lip curled , showing teeth as sharp as a row of daggers .
Duvall lunged back again , in an utter and consuming rage .

On each side were stalls heaped with fruit , vegetables , fish and other staples , behind which strapping black-shawled women bawled produce and price , oblivious of the packs of snarling dogs and ragged children lunging in and out between them for whatever scraps they could scavenge .
A girl lunged over the grid , screaming that she had made a mistake , fingers just missing the disappearing chips .
As the guns were still being fired , a Syrian tank came lunging up the shattered street where we had just been walking and entered the tiny square .
It lunged up the stairs again , after them .

In a nightmare-blur of frenzied activity , Cardiff saw Duvall lunging back through the storm in their direction , a shower of sparkling glass on his shoulders ; saw Rohmer seize Gilbert by the collar of his jacket and whirl him away bodily from the monstrous , thrashing shape and drag him backwards , hair and coat whipping madly in the hellwind .
Meredith lunged out in a desperate attempt to save their contents only to find her feet slipping on the melted snow which had been walked in from outside .
He lunged forward , tore the wooden leg out of Fabio 's hand and sent it hurtling across the room into a glass case of pink plaster hearts .
He tripped on the bottom step and , losing one boot , lunged forwards , cartwheeling across the pavement on that deadly crutch of glass .
She lunged forward and snatched the soap from me .
Like a thirsty horse making for water , I lunged .
